4855  // filter out the markers at measure stop
4856  const Marker* const mk = toMarker(e);
4857  Marker::Type mtp = mk->markerType();
4858  if (mtp == Marker::Type::FINE ||
4859  mtp == Marker::Type::TOCODA ||
4860  mtp == Marker::Type::TOCODASYM) {
4861  directionMarker(xml, mk);
4862  }
4863  else if (mtp == Marker::Type::SEGNO || mtp == Marker::Type::CODA) {
4864  // ignore
4865  }
4866  else {
4867  qDebug("repeatAtMeasureStop: marker %d not implemented", int(mtp));
4868  }
4869  }
4870  break;
4871  case ElementType::JUMP:
4872  directionJump(xml, toJump(e));
4873  break;
4874  default:
4875  qDebug("repeatAtMeasureStop: direction type %s at tick %d not implemented",
4876  Element::name(e->type()), m->tick().ticks());
4877  break;
4878  }
4879  }
4880  }
4881 
4882 //---------------------------------------------------------
4883 // work -- write the <work> element
4884 // note that order must be work-number, work-title
4885 // also write <movement-number> and <movement-title>
4886 // data is taken from the score metadata instead of the Text elements
4887 //---------------------------------------------------------
4888 
4889 void ExportMusicXml::work(const MeasureBase* /*measure*/)
4890  {
4891  QString workTitle = _score->metaTag("workTitle");
4892  QString workNumber = _score->metaTag("workNumber");
4893  if (!(workTitle.isEmpty() && workNumber.isEmpty())) {
4894  _xml.stag("work");
4895  if (!workNumber.isEmpty())
4896  _xml.tag("work-number", workNumber);
4897  if (!workTitle.isEmpty())
4898  _xml.tag("work-title", workTitle);
4899  _xml.etag();
4900  }
4901  if (!_score->metaTag("movementNumber").isEmpty())
4902  _xml.tag("movement-number", _score->metaTag("movementNumber"));
4903  if (!_score->metaTag("movementTitle").isEmpty())
4904  _xml.tag("movement-title", _score->metaTag("movementTitle"));
4905  }
4906 
4907 #if 0
4908 //---------------------------------------------------------
4909 // elementRighter // used for harmony order
4910 //---------------------------------------------------------
4911 
4912 static bool elementRighter(const Element* e1, const Element* e2)
4913  {
4914  return e1->x() < e2->x();
4915  }
4916 #endif
4917 
4918 //---------------------------------------------------------
4919 // measureStyle -- write measure-style
4920 //---------------------------------------------------------
4921 
4922 // this is done at the first measure of a multi-meaure rest
4923 // note: for a normal measure, mmRest1 is the measure itself,
4924 // for a multi-meaure rest, it is the replacing measure
4925 
4926 static void measureStyle(XmlWriter& xml, Attributes& attr, const Measure* const m)
4927  {
4928  const Measure* mmR1 = m->mmRest1();
4929  if (m != mmR1 && m == mmR1->mmRestFirst()) {
4930  attr.doAttr(xml, true);
4931  xml.stag("measure-style");
4932  xml.tag("multiple-rest", mmR1->mmRestCount());
4933  xml.etag();
4934  }
4935  }
4936 
4937 //---------------------------------------------------------
4938 // commonAnnotations
4939 //---------------------------------------------------------
4940 
4941 static bool commonAnnotations(ExportMusicXml* exp, const Element* e, int sstaff)
4942  {
4943  bool instrChangeHandled = false;
4944 
4945  // note: write the changed instrument details (transposition) here,
4946  // optionally writing the associated staff text is done below
4947  if (e->isInstrumentChange()) {
4948  const auto instrChange = toInstrumentChange(e);
4949  exp->writeInstrumentDetails(instrChange->instrument());
4950  instrChangeHandled = true;
4951  }
4952 
4953  if (e->isSymbol())
4954  exp->symbol(toSymbol(e), sstaff);
4955  else if (e->isTempoText())
4956  exp->tempoText(toTempoText(e), sstaff);
4957  else if (e->isStaffText() || e->isSystemText() || e->isText() || (e->isInstrumentChange() && e->visible()))
4958  exp->words(toTextBase(e), sstaff);
4959  else if (e->isDynamic())
4960  exp->dynamic(toDynamic(e), sstaff);
4961  else if (e->isRehearsalMark())
4962  exp->rehearsal(toRehearsalMark(e), sstaff);
4963  else
4964  return instrChangeHandled;
4965 
4966  return true;
4967  }
4968 
4969 //---------------------------------------------------------
4970 // annotations
4971 //---------------------------------------------------------
4972 
4973 // Only handle common annotations, others are handled elsewhere
4974 
4975 static void annotations(ExportMusicXml* exp, int strack, int etrack, int track, int sstaff, Segment* seg)
4976  {
4977  for (const Element* e : seg->annotations()) {
4978 
4979  int wtrack = -1; // track to write annotation
4980 
4981  if (strack <= e->track() && e->track() < etrack)
4982  wtrack = findTrackForAnnotations(e->track(), seg);
4983 
4984  if (track == wtrack) {
4985  if (commonAnnotations(exp, e, sstaff)) {
4986  ; // already handled
4987  }
4988  }
4989  }
4990  }
4991 
4992 //---------------------------------------------------------
4993 // harmonies
4994 //---------------------------------------------------------
4995 
4996 /*
4997  * Helper method to export harmonies and chord diagrams for a single segment.
4998  */
4999 
5000 static void segmentHarmonies(ExportMusicXml* exp, int track, Segment* seg, int offset)
5001  {
5002  const std::vector<Element*> diagrams = seg->findAnnotations(ElementType::FRET_DIAGRAM, track, track);
5003  std::vector<Element*> harmonies = seg->findAnnotations(ElementType::HARMONY, track, track);
5004 
5005  for (const Element* e : diagrams) {
5006  const FretDiagram* diagram = toFretDiagram(e);
5007  const Harmony* harmony = diagram->harmony();
5008  if (harmony) {
5009  exp->harmony(harmony, diagram, offset);
5010  }
5011  else if (!harmonies.empty()) {
5012  const Element* defaultHarmony = harmonies.back();
5013  exp->harmony(toHarmony(defaultHarmony), diagram, offset);
5014  harmonies.pop_back();
5015  }
5016  else {
5017  // Found a fret diagram with no harmony, ignore
5018  qDebug("segmentHarmonies() seg %p found fretboard diagram %p w/o harmony: cannot write", seg, diagram);
5019  }
5020  }
5021 
5022  for (const Element* e: harmonies)
5023  exp->harmony(toHarmony(e), 0, offset);
5024  }
5025 
5026 /*
5027  * Write harmonies and fret diagrams that are attached to chords or rests.
5028  *
5029  * There are fondamental differences between the ways Musescore and MusicXML handle harmonies (Chord symbols)
5030  * and fretboard diagrams.
5031  *
5032  * In MuseScore, the Harmony element is now a child of FretboardDiagram BUT in previous versions,
5033  * both elements were independant siblings so we have to handle both cases.
5034  * In MusicXML, fretboard diagram is always contained in a harmony element.
5035  *
5036  * In MuseScore, Harmony elements are not always linked to notes, and each Harmony will be contained
5037  * in a `ChordRest` Segment.
5038  * In MusicXML, those successive Harmony elements must be exported before the note with different offsets.
5039  *
5040  * Edge cases that we simply cannot handle:
5041  * - as of MusicXML 3.1, there is no way to represent a diagram without an associated chord symbol,
5042  * so when we encounter such an object in MuseScore, we simply cannot export it.
5043  * - If a ChordRest segment contans a FretboardDiagram with no harmonies and several different Harmony siblings,
5044  * we simply have to pick a random one to export.
5045  */
5046 
5047 static void harmonies(ExportMusicXml* exp, int track, Segment* seg, int divisions)
5048  {
5049  int offset = 0;
5050  segmentHarmonies(exp, track, seg, offset);
5051 
5052  // Edge case: find remaining `harmony` elements.
5053  // Suppose you have one single whole note in the measure but several chord symbols.
5054  // In MuseScore, each `Harmony` object will be stored in a `ChordRest` Segment that contains
5055  // no other Chords.
5056  // But in MusicXML, you are supposed to output all `harmony` elements before the first `note`,
5057  // with different `offset` parameters.
5058  //
5059  // That's why we need to explore the remaining segments to find
5060  // `Harmony` and `FretDiagram` elements in Segments without Chords and output them now.
5061  for (auto seg1 = seg->next(); seg1; seg1 = seg1->next()) {
5062  if (!seg1->isChordRestType())
5063  continue;
5064 
5065  const auto el1 = seg1->element(track);
5066  if (el1) // found a ChordRest, next harmony will be attached to this one
5067  break;
5068 
5069  offset = (seg1->tick() - seg->tick()).ticks() / divisions;
5070  segmentHarmonies(exp, track, seg1, offset);
5071  }
5072  }
5073 
5074 //---------------------------------------------------------
5075 // figuredBass
5076 //---------------------------------------------------------
5077 
5078 static void figuredBass(XmlWriter& xml, int strack, int etrack, int track, const ChordRest* cr, FigBassMap& fbMap, int divisions)
5079  {
5080  Segment* seg = cr->segment();
5081  if (seg->segmentType() == SegmentType::ChordRest) {
5082  for (const Element* e : seg->annotations()) {
5083 
5084  int wtrack = -1; // track to write annotation
5085 
5086  if (strack <= e->track() && e->track() < etrack)
5087  wtrack = findTrackForAnnotations(e->track(), seg);
5088 
5089  if (track == wtrack) {
5090  if (e->type() == ElementType::FIGURED_BASS) {
5091  const FiguredBass* fb = dynamic_cast<const FiguredBass*>(e);
5092  //qDebug("figuredbass() track %d seg %p fb %p seg %p tick %d ticks %d cr %p tick %d ticks %d",
5093  // track, seg, fb, fb->segment(), fb->segment()->tick(), fb->ticks(), cr, cr->tick(), cr->actualTicks());
5094  bool extend = fb->ticks() > cr->actualTicks();
5095  if (extend) {
5096  //qDebug("figuredbass() extend to %d + %d = %d",
5097  // cr->tick(), fb->ticks(), cr->tick() + fb->ticks());
5098  fbMap.insert(strack, fb);
5099  }
5100  else
5101  fbMap.remove(strack);
5102  const Fraction crEndTick = cr->tick() + cr->actualTicks();
5103  const Fraction fbEndTick = fb->segment()->tick() + fb->ticks();
5104  const bool writeDuration = fb->ticks() < cr->actualTicks();
5105  fb->writeMusicXML(xml, true, crEndTick.ticks(), fbEndTick.ticks(),
5106  writeDuration, divisions);
5107 
5108  // Check for changing figures under a single note (each figure stored in a separate segment)
5109  for (Segment* segNext = seg->next(); segNext && segNext->element(track) == NULL; segNext = segNext->next()) {
5110  for (Element* annot : segNext->annotations()) {
5111  if (annot->type() == ElementType::FIGURED_BASS && annot->track() == track) {
5112  fb = dynamic_cast<const FiguredBass*>(annot);
5113  fb->writeMusicXML(xml, true, 0, 0, true, divisions);
5114  }
5115  }
5116  }
5117  // no extend can be pending
5118  return;
5119  }
5120  }
5121  }
5122  // check for extend pending
5123  if (fbMap.contains(strack)) {
5124  const FiguredBass* fb = fbMap.value(strack);
5125  Fraction crEndTick = cr->tick() + cr->actualTicks();
5126  Fraction fbEndTick = fb->segment()->tick() + fb->ticks();
5127  bool writeDuration = fb->ticks() < cr->actualTicks();
5128  if (cr->tick() < fbEndTick) {
5129  //qDebug("figuredbass() at tick %d extend only", cr->tick());
5130  fb->writeMusicXML(xml, false, crEndTick.ticks(), fbEndTick.ticks(), writeDuration, divisions);
5131  }
5132  if (fbEndTick <= crEndTick) {
5133  //qDebug("figuredbass() at tick %d extend done", cr->tick() + cr->actualTicks());
5134  fbMap.remove(strack);
5135  }
5136  }
5137  }
5138  }
5139 
5140 //---------------------------------------------------------
5141 // spannerStart
5142 //---------------------------------------------------------
5143 
5144 // for each spanner start:
5145 // find start track
5146 // find stop track
5147 // if stop track < start track
5148 // get data from list of already stopped spanners
5149 // else
5150 // calculate data
5151 // write start if in right track
5152 
5153 static void spannerStart(ExportMusicXml* exp, int strack, int etrack, int track, int sstaff, Segment* seg)
5154  {
5155  if (seg->segmentType() == SegmentType::ChordRest) {
5156  Fraction stick = seg->tick();
5157  for (auto it = exp->score()->spanner().lower_bound(stick.ticks()); it != exp->score()->spanner().upper_bound(stick.ticks()); ++it) {
5158  Spanner* e = it->second;
5159 
5160  int wtrack = -1; // track to write spanner
5161  if (strack <= e->track() && e->track() < etrack)
5162  wtrack = findTrackForAnnotations(e->track(), seg);
5163 
5164  if (track == wtrack) {
5165  switch (e->type()) {
5166  case ElementType::HAIRPIN:
5167  exp->hairpin(toHairpin(e), sstaff, seg->tick());
5168  break;
5169  case ElementType::OTTAVA:
5170  exp->ottava(toOttava(e), sstaff, seg->tick());
5171  break;
5172  case ElementType::PEDAL:
5173  exp->pedal(toPedal(e), sstaff, seg->tick());
5174  break;
5175  case ElementType::TEXTLINE:
5176  exp->textLine(toTextLineBase(e), sstaff, seg->tick());
5177  break;
5178  case ElementType::LET_RING:
5179  exp->textLine(toLetRing(e), sstaff, seg->tick());
5180  break;
5181  case ElementType::PALM_MUTE:
5182  exp->textLine(toPalmMute(e), sstaff, seg->tick());
5183  break;
5184  case ElementType::TRILL:
5185  // ignore (written as <note><notations><ornaments><wavy-line>)
5186  break;
5187  case ElementType::SLUR:
5188  // ignore (written as <note><notations><slur>)
5189  break;
5190  default:
5191  qDebug("spannerStart: direction type %d ('%s') at tick %d not implemented",
5192  int(e->type()), Element::name(e->type()), seg->tick().ticks());
5193  break;
5194  }
5195  }
5196  } // for
5197  }
5198  }
5199 
5200 //---------------------------------------------------------
5201 // spannerStop
5202 //---------------------------------------------------------
5203 
5204 // called after writing each chord or rest to check if a spanner must be stopped
5205 // loop over all spanners and find spanners in strack ending at tick2
5206 // note that more than one voice may contains notes ending at tick2,
5207 // remember which spanners have already been stopped (the "stopped" set)
5208 
5209 static void spannerStop(ExportMusicXml* exp, int strack, int etrack, const Fraction& tick2, int sstaff, QSet<const Spanner*>& stopped)
5210  {
5211  for (auto it : exp->score()->spanner()) {
5212  Spanner* e = it.second;
5213 
5214  if (e->tick2() != tick2 || e->track() < strack || e->track() >= etrack)
5215  continue;
5216 
5217  if (!stopped.contains(e)) {
5218  stopped.insert(e);
5219  switch (e->type()) {
5220  case ElementType::HAIRPIN:
5221  exp->hairpin(toHairpin(e), sstaff, Fraction(-1,1));
5222  break;
5223  case ElementType::OTTAVA:
5224  exp->ottava(toOttava(e), sstaff, Fraction(-1,1));
5225  break;
5226  case ElementType::PEDAL:
5227  exp->pedal(toPedal(e), sstaff, Fraction(-1,1));
5228  break;
5229  case ElementType::TEXTLINE:
5230  exp->textLine(toTextLineBase(e), sstaff, Fraction(-1,1));
5231  break;
5232  case ElementType::LET_RING:
5233  exp->textLine(toLetRing(e), sstaff, Fraction(-1,1));
5234  break;
5235  case ElementType::PALM_MUTE:
5236  exp->textLine(toPalmMute(e), sstaff, Fraction(-1,1));
5237  break;
5238  case ElementType::TRILL:
5239  // ignore (written as <note><notations><ornaments><wavy-line>
5240  break;
5241  case ElementType::SLUR:
5242  // ignore (written as <note><notations><slur>)
5243  break;
5244  default:
5245  qDebug("spannerStop: direction type %s at tick2 %d not implemented",
5246  Element::name(e->type()), tick2.ticks());
5247  break;
5248  }
5249  }
5250  } // for
5251  }
5252 
5253 //---------------------------------------------------------
5254 // keysigTimesig
5255 //---------------------------------------------------------
5256 
5257 /**
5258  Output attributes at start of measure: key, time
5259  */
5260 
5261 void ExportMusicXml::keysigTimesig(const Measure* m, const Part* p)
5262  {
5263  int strack = p->startTrack();
5264  int etrack = p->endTrack();
5265  //qDebug("keysigTimesig m %p strack %d etrack %d", m, strack, etrack);
5266 
5267  // search all staves for non-generated key signatures
5268  QMap<int, KeySig*> keysigs; // map staff to key signature
5269  for (Segment* seg = m->first(); seg; seg = seg->next()) {
5270  if (seg->tick() > m->tick())
5271  break;
5272  for (int t = strack; t < etrack; t += VOICES) {
5273  Element* el = seg->element(t);
5274  if (!el)
5275  continue;
5276  if (el->type() == ElementType::KEYSIG) {
5277  //qDebug(" found keysig %p track %d", el, el->track());
5278  int st = (t - strack) / VOICES;
5279  if (!el->generated())
5280  keysigs[st] = static_cast<KeySig*>(el);
5281  }
5282  }
5283  }
5284 
5285  //ClefType ct = rest->staff()->clef(rest->tick());
5286 
5287  // write the key signatues
5288  if (!keysigs.isEmpty()) {
5289  // determine if all staves have a keysig and all keysigs are identical
5290  // in that case a single <key> is written, without number=... attribute
5291  int nstaves = p->nstaves();
5292  bool singleKey = true;
5293  // check if all staves have a keysig
5294  for (int i = 0; i < nstaves; i++)
5295  if (!keysigs.contains(i))
5296  singleKey = false;
5297  // check if all keysigs are identical
5298  if (singleKey)
5299  for (int i = 1; i < nstaves; i++)
5300  if (!(keysigs.value(i)->key() == keysigs.value(0)->key()))
5301  singleKey = false;
5302 
5303  // write the keysigs
5304  //qDebug(" singleKey %d", singleKey);
5305  if (singleKey) {
5306  // keysig applies to all staves
5307  keysig(keysigs.value(0), p->staff(0)->clef(m->tick()), 0, keysigs.value(0)->visible());
5308  }
5309  else {
5310  // staff-specific keysigs
5311  for (int st : keysigs.keys())
5312  keysig(keysigs.value(st), p->staff(st)->clef(m->tick()), st + 1, keysigs.value(st)->visible());
5313  }
5314  }
5315  else {
5316  // always write a keysig at tick = 0
5317  if (m->tick().isZero()) {
5318  //KeySigEvent kse;
5319  //kse.setKey(Key::C);
5320  KeySig* ks = new KeySig(_score);
5321  ks->setKey(Key::C);
5322  keysig(ks, p->staff(0)->clef(m->tick()));
5323  delete ks;
5324  }
5325  }
5326 
5327  TimeSig* tsig = 0;
5328  for (Segment* seg = m->first(); seg; seg = seg->next()) {
5329  if (seg->tick() > m->tick())
5330  break;
5331  Element* el = seg->element(strack);
5332  if (el && el->type() == ElementType::TIMESIG)
5333  tsig = (TimeSig*) el;
5334  }
5335  if (tsig)
5336  timesig(tsig);
5337  }
5338 
5339 //---------------------------------------------------------
5340 // identification -- write the identification
5341 //---------------------------------------------------------
5342 
5343 static void identification(XmlWriter& xml, Score const* const score)
5344  {
5345  xml.stag("identification");
5346 
5347  QStringList creators;
5348  // the creator types commonly found in MusicXML
5349  creators << "arranger" << "composer" << "lyricist" << "poet" << "translator";
5350  for (const QString &type : qAsConst(creators)) {
5351  QString creator = score->metaTag(type);
5352  if (!creator.isEmpty())
5353  xml.tag(QString("creator type=\"%1\"").arg(type), creator);
5354  }
5355 
5356  if (!score->metaTag("copyright").isEmpty())
5357  xml.tag("rights", score->metaTag("copyright"));
5358 
5359  xml.stag("encoding");
5360 
5361  if (MScore::debugMode) {
5362  xml.tag("software", QString("MuseScore 0.7.0"));
5363  xml.tag("encoding-date", QString("2007-09-10"));
5364  }
5365  else {
5366  xml.tag("software", QString("MuseScore ") + QString(VERSION));
5367  xml.tag("encoding-date", QDate::currentDate().toString(Qt::ISODate));
5368  }
5369 
5370  // specify supported elements
5371  xml.tagE("supports element=\"accidental\" type=\"yes\"");
5372  xml.tagE("supports element=\"beam\" type=\"yes\"");
5373  // set support for print new-page and new-system to match user preference
5374  // for MusicxmlExportBreaks::MANUAL support is "no" because "yes" breaks Finale NotePad import
5375  if (preferences.getBool(PREF_EXPORT_MUSICXML_EXPORTLAYOUT)
5376  && preferences.musicxmlExportBreaks() == MusicxmlExportBreaks::ALL) {
5377  xml.tagE("supports element=\"print\" attribute=\"new-page\" type=\"yes\" value=\"yes\"");
5378  xml.tagE("supports element=\"print\" attribute=\"new-system\" type=\"yes\" value=\"yes\"");
5379  }
5380  else {
5381  xml.tagE("supports element=\"print\" attribute=\"new-page\" type=\"no\"");
5382  xml.tagE("supports element=\"print\" attribute=\"new-system\" type=\"no\"");
5383  }
5384  xml.tagE("supports element=\"stem\" type=\"yes\"");
5385 
5386  xml.etag();
5387 
5388  if (!score->metaTag("source").isEmpty())
5389  xml.tag("source", score->metaTag("source"));
5390 
5391  xml.etag();
5392  }
5393 
5394 //---------------------------------------------------------
5395 // findPartGroupNumber
5396 //---------------------------------------------------------
5397 
5398 static int findPartGroupNumber(int* partGroupEnd)
5399  {
5400  // find part group number
5401  for (int number = 0; number < MAX_PART_GROUPS; ++number)
5402  if (partGroupEnd[number] == -1)
5403  return number;
5404  qDebug("no free part group number");
5405  return MAX_PART_GROUPS;
5406  }
5407 
5408 //---------------------------------------------------------
5409 // scoreInstrument
5410 //---------------------------------------------------------
5411 
5412 static void scoreInstrument(XmlWriter& xml, const int partNr, const int instrNr, const QString& instrName)
5413  {
5414  xml.stag(QString("score-instrument %1").arg(instrId(partNr, instrNr)));
5415  xml.tag("instrument-name", instrName);
5416  xml.etag();
5417  }
5418 
5419 //---------------------------------------------------------
5420 // midiInstrument
5421 //---------------------------------------------------------
5422 
5423 static void midiInstrument(XmlWriter& xml, const int partNr, const int instrNr,
5424  const Instrument* instr, const Score* score, const int unpitched = 0)
5425  {
5426  xml.stag(QString("midi-instrument %1").arg(instrId(partNr, instrNr)));
5427  int midiChannel = score->masterScore()->midiChannel(instr->channel(0)->channel());
5428  if (midiChannel >= 0 && midiChannel < 16)
5429  xml.tag("midi-channel", midiChannel + 1);
5430  int midiProgram = instr->channel(0)->program();
5431  if (midiProgram >= 0 && midiProgram < 128)
5432  xml.tag("midi-program", midiProgram + 1);
5433  if (unpitched > 0)
5434  xml.tag("midi-unpitched", unpitched);
5435  xml.tag("volume", (instr->channel(0)->volume() / 127.0) * 100); //percent
5436  xml.tag("pan", int(((instr->channel(0)->pan() - 63.5) / 63.5) * 90)); //-90 hard left, +90 hard right xml.etag();
5437  xml.etag();
5438  }
5439 
5440 //---------------------------------------------------------
5441 // initInstrMap
5442 //---------------------------------------------------------
5443 
5444 /**
5445  Initialize the Instrument* to number map for a Part
5446  Used to generate instrument numbers for a multi-instrument part
5447  */
5448 
5449 static void initInstrMap(MxmlInstrumentMap& im, const InstrumentList* il, const Score* /*score*/)
5450  {
5451  im.clear();
5452  for (auto i = il->begin(); i != il->end(); ++i) {
5453  const Instrument* pinstr = i->second;
5454  if (!im.contains(pinstr))
5455  im.insert(pinstr, im.size());
5456  }
5457  }
5458 
5459 //---------------------------------------------------------
5460 // initReverseInstrMap
5461 //---------------------------------------------------------
5462 
5463 typedef QMap<int, const Instrument*> MxmlReverseInstrumentMap;
5464 
5465 /**
5466  Initialize the number t Instrument* map for a Part
5467  Used to iterate in sequence over instrument numbers for a multi-instrument part
5468  */
5469 
5470 static void initReverseInstrMap(MxmlReverseInstrumentMap& rim, const MxmlInstrumentMap& im)
5471  {
5472  rim.clear();
5473  for (const Instrument* i : im.keys()) {
5474  int instNr = im.value(i);
5475  rim.insert(instNr, i);
5476  }
5477  }
5478 
5479 //---------------------------------------------------------
5480 // hasPageBreak
5481 //---------------------------------------------------------
5482 
5483 static MeasureBase* lastMeasureBase(const System* const system)
5484  {
5485  MeasureBase* mb = nullptr;
5486  if (system) {
5487  const auto& measures = system->measures();
5488  Q_ASSERT(!(measures.empty()));
5489  mb = measures.back();
5490  }
5491  return mb;
5492  }
5493 
5494 //---------------------------------------------------------
5495 // hasPageBreak
5496 //---------------------------------------------------------
5497 
5498 static bool hasPageBreak(const System* const system)
5499  {
5500  const MeasureBase* mb = nullptr;
5501  if (system) {
5502  const auto& measures = system->measures();
5503  Q_ASSERT(!(measures.empty()));
5504  mb = measures.back();
5505  }
5506 
5507  return mb && mb->pageBreak();
5508  }
5509 
5510 //---------------------------------------------------------
5511 // print
5512 //---------------------------------------------------------
5513 
5514 /**
5515  Handle the <print> element.
5516  When exporting layout and all breaks, a <print> with layout information
5517  is generated for the first measure in the score, in a system or on a page.
5518  When exporting layout but only manual or no breaks, a <print> with
5519  layout information is generated only for the first measure in the score,
5520  as it is assumed the system layout is broken by the importing application
5521  anyway and is thus useless.
5522 
5523  a page break is explicit (manual) if:
5524  - the last system on the previous page has a page break
5525  a system break is explicit (manual) if:
5526  - the previous system in the score has a system or layout break
5527  - if the previous system in the score does not have measures
5528  (i.e. only has (a) frame(s))
5529  */
5530 
5531 void ExportMusicXml::print(const Measure* const m, const int partNr, const int firstStaffOfPart, const int nrStavesInPart, const MeasurePrintContext& mpc)
5532  {
5533  const MeasureBase* const prevSysMB = lastMeasureBase(mpc.prevSystem);
5534 
5535  const bool prevMeasLineBreak = prevSysMB ? prevSysMB->lineBreak() : false;
5536  const bool prevMeasSectionBreak = prevSysMB ? prevSysMB->sectionBreak() : false;
5537  const bool prevPageBreak = hasPageBreak(mpc.lastSystemPrevPage);
5538 
5539  QString newSystemOrPage; // new-[system|page]="yes" or empty
5540  if (!mpc.scoreStart) {
5541  if (preferences.musicxmlExportBreaks() == MusicxmlExportBreaks::ALL) {
5542  if (mpc.pageStart) newSystemOrPage = " new-page=\"yes\"";
5543  else if (mpc.systemStart) newSystemOrPage = " new-system=\"yes\"";
5544  }
5545  else if (preferences.musicxmlExportBreaks() == MusicxmlExportBreaks::MANUAL) {
5546  if (mpc.pageStart && prevPageBreak)
5547  newSystemOrPage = " new-page=\"yes\"";
5548  else if (mpc.systemStart && (prevMeasLineBreak || prevMeasSectionBreak))
5549  newSystemOrPage = " new-system=\"yes\"";
5550  }
5551  }
5552 
5553  bool doBreak = mpc.scoreStart || (newSystemOrPage != "");
5554  bool doLayout = preferences.getBool(PREF_EXPORT_MUSICXML_EXPORTLAYOUT);
5555 
5556  if (doBreak) {
5557  if (doLayout) {
5558  _xml.stag(QString("print%1").arg(newSystemOrPage));
5559  const double pageWidth = getTenthsFromInches(score()->styleD(Sid::pageWidth));
5560  const double lm = getTenthsFromInches(score()->styleD(Sid::pageOddLeftMargin));
5561  const double rm = getTenthsFromInches(score()->styleD(Sid::pageWidth)
5562  - score()->styleD(Sid::pagePrintableWidth) - score()->styleD(Sid::pageOddLeftMargin));
5563  const double tm = getTenthsFromInches(score()->styleD(Sid::pageOddTopMargin));
5564 
5565  // System Layout
5566 
5567  // For a multi-meaure rest positioning is valid only
5568  // in the replacing measure
5569  // note: for a normal measure, mmRest1 is the measure itself,
5570  // for a multi-meaure rest, it is the replacing measure
5571  const Measure* mmR1 = m->mmRest1();
5572  const System* system = mmR1->system();
5573 
5574  // Put the system print suggestions only for the first part in a score...
5575  if (partNr == 0) {
5576 
5577  // Find the right margin of the system.
5578  double systemLM = getTenthsFromDots(mmR1->pagePos().x() - system->page()->pagePos().x()) - lm;
5579  double systemRM = pageWidth - rm - (getTenthsFromDots(system->bbox().width()) + lm);
5580 
5581  _xml.stag("system-layout");
5582  _xml.stag("system-margins");
5583  _xml.tag("left-margin", QString("%1").arg(QString::number(systemLM,'f',2)));
5584  _xml.tag("right-margin", QString("%1").arg(QString::number(systemRM,'f',2)) );
5585  _xml.etag();
5586 
5587  if (mpc.systemStart && !mpc.pageStart) {
5588  // see System::layout2() for the factor 2 * score()->spatium()
5589  const double sysDist = getTenthsFromDots(mmR1->pagePos().y()
5590  - mpc.prevMeasure->pagePos().y()
5591  - mpc.prevMeasure->bbox().height()
5592  + 2 * score()->spatium()
5593  );
5594  _xml.tag("system-distance",
5595  QString("%1").arg(QString::number(sysDist,'f',2)));
5596  }
5597  if (mpc.pageStart || mpc.scoreStart) {
5598  const double topSysDist = getTenthsFromDots(mmR1->pagePos().y()) - tm;
5599  _xml.tag("top-system-distance", QString("%1").arg(QString::number(topSysDist,'f',2)) );
5600  }
5601 
5602  _xml.etag();
5603  }
5604 
5605  // Staff layout elements.
5606  for (int staffIdx = (firstStaffOfPart == 0) ? 1 : 0; staffIdx < nrStavesInPart; staffIdx++) {
5607 
5608  // calculate distance between this and previous staff using the bounding boxes
5609  const auto staffNr = firstStaffOfPart + staffIdx;
5610  const auto prevBbox = system->staff(staffNr - 1)->bbox();
5611  const auto staffDist = system->staff(staffNr)->bbox().y() - prevBbox.y() - prevBbox.height();
5612 
5613  _xml.stag(QString("staff-layout number=\"%1\"").arg(staffIdx + 1));
5614  _xml.tag("staff-distance", QString("%1").arg(QString::number(getTenthsFromDots(staffDist),'f',2)));
5615  _xml.etag();
5616  }
5617 
5618  _xml.etag();
5619  }
5620  else if (newSystemOrPage != "") {
5621  _xml.tagE(QString("print%1").arg(newSystemOrPage));
5622  }
5623  }
5624  }
5625 
5626 //---------------------------------------------------------
5627 // exportDefaultClef
5628 //---------------------------------------------------------
5629 
5630 /**
5631  In case no clef is found, export a default clef with type determined by staff type.
5632  Note that a multi-measure rest starting in the first measure should be handled correctly.
5633  */
5634 
5635 void ExportMusicXml::exportDefaultClef(const Part* const part, const Measure* const m)
5636  {
5637  const auto staves = part->nstaves();
5638 
5639  if (m->tick() == Fraction(0,1)) {
5640  const auto clefSeg = m->findSegment(SegmentType::HeaderClef, Fraction(0,1));
5641 
5642  if (clefSeg) {
5643  for (int i = 0; i < staves; ++i) {
5644 
5645  // sstaff - xml staff number, counting from 1 for this
5646  // instrument
5647  // special number 0 -> don’t show staff number in
5648  // xml output (because there is only one staff)
5649 
5650  auto sstaff = (staves > 1) ? i + 1 : 0;
5651  auto track = part->startTrack() + VOICES * i;
5652 
5653  if (clefSeg->element(track) == nullptr) {
5654  ClefType ct { ClefType::G };
5655  QString stafftype;
5656  switch (part->staff(i)->staffType(Fraction(0,1))->group()) {
5657  case StaffGroup::TAB:
5658  ct = ClefType::TAB;
5659  stafftype = "tab";
5660  break;
5661  case StaffGroup::STANDARD:
5662  ct = ClefType::G;
5663  stafftype = "std";
5664  break;
5665  case StaffGroup::PERCUSSION:
5666  ct = ClefType::PERC;
5667  stafftype = "perc";
5668  break;
5669  }
5670  qDebug("no clef found in first measure track %d (stafftype %s)", track, qPrintable(stafftype));
5671  clef(sstaff, ct, " print-object=\"no\"");
5672  }
5673  }
5674  }
5675  }
5676  }
5677 
5678 //---------------------------------------------------------
5679 // findAndExportClef
5680 //---------------------------------------------------------
5681 
5682 /**
5683  Make sure clefs at end of measure get exported at start of next measure.
5684  */
5685 
5686 void ExportMusicXml::findAndExportClef(const Measure* const m, const int staves, const int strack, const int etrack)
5687  {
5688  Measure* prevMeasure = m->prevMeasure();
5689  Measure* mmR = m->mmRest(); // the replacing measure in a multi-measure rest
5690  Fraction tick = m->tick();
5691  Segment* cs1;
5692  Segment* cs2 = m->findSegment(SegmentType::Clef, tick);
5693  Segment* cs3;
5694  Segment* seg = 0;
5695 
5696  if (prevMeasure)
5697  cs1 = prevMeasure->findSegment(SegmentType::Clef, tick);
5698  else
5699  cs1 = m->findSegment(SegmentType::HeaderClef, tick);
5700 
5701  if (mmR) {
5702  cs3 = mmR->findSegment(SegmentType::HeaderClef, tick);
5703  if (!cs3)
5704  cs3 = mmR->findSegment(SegmentType::Clef, tick);
5705  }
5706  else
5707  cs3 = 0;
5708 
5709  if (cs1 && cs2) {
5710  // should only happen at begin of new system
5711  // when previous system ends with a non-generated clef
5712  seg = cs1;
5713  }
5714  else if (cs1)
5715  seg = cs1;
5716  else if (cs3) {
5717  // happens when the first measure is a multi-measure rest
5718  // containing a generated clef
5719  seg = cs3;
5720  }
5721  else
5722  seg = cs2;
5723  clefDebug("exportxml: clef segments cs1=%p cs2=%p cs3=%p seg=%p", cs1, cs2, cs3, seg);
5724 
5725  // output attribute at start of measure: clef
5726  if (seg) {
5727  for (int st = strack; st < etrack; st += VOICES) {
5728  // sstaff - xml staff number, counting from 1 for this
5729  // instrument
5730  // special number 0 -> don’t show staff number in
5731  // xml output (because there is only one staff)
5732 
5733  int sstaff = (staves > 1) ? st - strack + VOICES : 0;
5734  sstaff /= VOICES;
5735 
5736  Clef* cle = static_cast<Clef*>(seg->element(st));
5737  if (cle) {
5738  clefDebug("exportxml: clef at start measure ti=%d ct=%d gen=%d", tick, int(cle->clefType()), cle->generated());
5739  // output only clef changes, not generated clefs at line beginning
5740  // exception: at tick=0, export clef anyway
5741  if ((tick.isZero() || !cle->generated()) && ((seg->measure() != m) || ((seg->segmentType() == SegmentType::HeaderClef) && !cle->otherClef()))) {
5742  clefDebug("exportxml: clef exported");
5743  clef(sstaff, cle->clefType(), color2xml(cle));
5744  }
5745  else {
5746  clefDebug("exportxml: clef not exported");
5747  }
5748  }
5749  }
5750  }
5751  }
5752 
5753 //---------------------------------------------------------
5754 // findPitchesUsed
5755 //---------------------------------------------------------
5756 
5757 /**
5758  Find the set of pitches actually used in a part.
5759  */
5760 
5761 typedef QSet<int> pitchSet; // the set of pitches used
5762 
5763 static void addChordPitchesToSet(const Chord* c, pitchSet& set)
5764  {
5765  for (const Note* note : c->notes()) {
5766  qDebug("chord %p note %p pitch %d", c, note, note->pitch() + 1);
5767  set.insert(note->pitch());
5768  }
5769  }
5770 
5771 static void findPitchesUsed(const Part* part, pitchSet& set)
5772  {
5773  int strack = part->startTrack();
5774  int etrack = part->endTrack();
5775 
5776  // loop over all chords in the part
5777  for (const MeasureBase* mb = part->score()->measures()->first(); mb; mb = mb->next()) {
5778  if (mb->type() != ElementType::MEASURE)
5779  continue;
5780  const Measure* m = static_cast<const Measure*>(mb);
5781  for (int st = strack; st < etrack; ++st) {
5782  for (Segment* seg = m->first(); seg; seg = seg->next()) {
5783  const Element* el = seg->element(st);
5784  if (!el)
5785  continue;
5786  if (el->type() == ElementType::CHORD)
5787  {
5788  // add grace and non-grace note pitches to the result set
5789  const Chord* c = static_cast<const Chord*>(el);
5790  if (c) {
5791  for (const Chord* g : c->graceNotesBefore()) {
5792  addChordPitchesToSet(g, set);
5793  }
5794  addChordPitchesToSet(c, set);
5795  for (const Chord* g : c->graceNotesAfter()) {
5796  addChordPitchesToSet(g, set);
5797  }
5798  }
5799  }
5800  }
5801  }
5802  }
5803  }
5804 
5805 //---------------------------------------------------------
5806 // partList
5807 //---------------------------------------------------------
5808 
5809 /**
5810  Write the part list to \a xml.
5811  */
5812 
5813 static void partList(XmlWriter& xml, Score* score, MxmlInstrumentMap& instrMap)
5814  {
5815  xml.stag("part-list");
5816  int staffCount = 0; // count sum of # staves in parts
5817  const auto& parts = score->parts();
5818  int partGroupEnd[MAX_PART_GROUPS]; // staff where part group ends (bracketSpan is in staves, not parts)
5819  for (int i = 0; i < MAX_PART_GROUPS; i++)
5820  partGroupEnd[i] = -1;
5821  for (int idx = 0; idx < parts.size(); ++idx) {
5822  const auto part = parts.at(idx);
5823  bool bracketFound = false;
5824  // handle brackets
5825  for (int i = 0; i < part->nstaves(); i++) {
5826  Staff* st = part->staff(i);
5827  if (st) {
5828  for (int j = 0; j < st->bracketLevels() + 1; j++) {
5829  if (st->bracketType(j) != BracketType::NO_BRACKET) {
5830  bracketFound = true;
5831  if (i == 0) {
5832  // OK, found bracket in first staff of part
5833  // filter out implicit brackets
5834  if (!(st->bracketSpan(j) == part->nstaves()
5835  && st->bracketType(j) == BracketType::BRACE)) {
5836  // add others
5837  int number = findPartGroupNumber(partGroupEnd);
5838  if (number < MAX_PART_GROUPS) {
5839  partGroupStart(xml, number + 1, st->bracketType(j));
5840  partGroupEnd[number] = staffCount + st->bracketSpan(j);
5841  }
5842  }
5843  }
5844  else {
5845  // bracket in other staff not supported in MusicXML
5846  qDebug("bracket starting in staff %d not supported", i + 1);
5847  }
5848  }
5849  }
5850  }
5851  }
5852  // handle bracket none
5853  if (!bracketFound && part->nstaves() > 1) {
5854  int number = findPartGroupNumber(partGroupEnd);
5855  if (number < MAX_PART_GROUPS) {
5856  partGroupStart(xml, number + 1, BracketType::NO_BRACKET);
5857  partGroupEnd[number] = idx + part->nstaves();
5858  }
5859  }
5860 
5861  xml.stag(QString("score-part id=\"P%1\"").arg(idx+1));
5862  initInstrMap(instrMap, part->instruments(), score);
5863  // by default export the parts long name as part-name
5864  if (part->longName() != "")
5865  xml.tag("part-name", MScoreTextToMXML::toPlainText(part->longName()));
5866  else {
5867  if (part->partName() != "") {
5868  // use the track name if no part long name
5869  // to prevent an empty track name on import
5870  xml.tag("part-name print-object=\"no\"", MScoreTextToMXML::toPlainText(part->partName()));
5871  }
5872  else
5873  // part-name is required
5874  xml.tag("part-name", "");
5875  }
5876  if (!part->shortName().isEmpty())
5877  xml.tag("part-abbreviation", MScoreTextToMXML::toPlainText(part->shortName()));
5878 
5879  if (part->instrument()->useDrumset()) {
5880  const Drumset* drumset = part->instrument()->drumset();
5881  pitchSet pitches;
5882  findPitchesUsed(part, pitches);
5883  for (int i = 0; i < 128; ++i) {
5884  DrumInstrument di = drumset->drum(i);
5885  if (di.notehead != NoteHead::Group::HEAD_INVALID)
5886  scoreInstrument(xml, idx + 1, i + 1, di.name);
5887  else if (pitches.contains(i))
5888  scoreInstrument(xml, idx + 1, i + 1, QString("Instrument %1").arg(i + 1));
5889  }
5890  int midiPort = part->midiPort() + 1;
5891  if (midiPort >= 1 && midiPort <= 16)
5892  xml.tag(QString("midi-device port=\"%1\"").arg(midiPort), "");
5893 
5894  for (int i = 0; i < 128; ++i) {
5895  DrumInstrument di = drumset->drum(i);
5896  if (di.notehead != NoteHead::Group::HEAD_INVALID || pitches.contains(i))
5897  midiInstrument(xml, idx + 1, i + 1, part->instrument(), score, i + 1);
5898  }
5899  }
5900  else {
5901  MxmlReverseInstrumentMap rim;
5902  initReverseInstrMap(rim, instrMap);
5903  for (int instNr : rim.keys()) {
5904  scoreInstrument(xml, idx + 1, instNr + 1, MScoreTextToMXML::toPlainText(rim.value(instNr)->trackName()));
5905  }
5906  for (auto ii = rim.constBegin(); ii != rim.constEnd(); ii++) {
5907  int instNr = ii.key();
5908  int midiPort = part->midiPort() + 1;
5909  if (ii.value()->channel().size() > 0)
5910  midiPort = score->masterScore()->midiMapping(ii.value()->channel(0)->channel())->port() + 1;
5911  if (midiPort >= 1 && midiPort <= 16)
5912  xml.tag(QString("midi-device %1 port=\"%2\"").arg(instrId(idx+1, instNr + 1)).arg(midiPort), "");
5913  else
5914  xml.tag(QString("midi-device %1").arg(instrId(idx+1, instNr + 1)), "");
5915  midiInstrument(xml, idx + 1, instNr + 1, rim.value(instNr), score);
5916  }
5917  }
5918 
5919  xml.etag();
5920  staffCount += part->nstaves();
5921  for (int i = MAX_PART_GROUPS - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
5922  int end = partGroupEnd[i];
5923  if (end >= 0) {
5924  if (staffCount >= end) {
5925  xml.tagE(QString("part-group type=\"stop\" number=\"%1\"").arg(i + 1));
5926  partGroupEnd[i] = -1;
5927  }
5928  }
5929  }
5930  }
5931  xml.etag();
5932 
5933  }
5934 
5935 //---------------------------------------------------------
5936 // tickIsInMiddleOfMeasure
5937 //---------------------------------------------------------
5938 
5939 static bool tickIsInMiddleOfMeasure(const Fraction ti, const Measure* m)
5940  {
5941  return ti != m->tick() && ti != m->endTick();
5942  }
5943 
5944 //---------------------------------------------------------
5945 // writeElement
5946 //---------------------------------------------------------
5947 
5948 /**
5949  Write \a el.
5950  */
5951 
5952 void ExportMusicXml::writeElement(Element* el, const Measure* m, int sstaff, bool useDrumset)
5953  {
5954  if (el->isClef()) {
5955  // output only clef changes, not generated clefs
5956  // at line beginning
5957  // also ignore clefs at the start of a measure,
5958  // these have already been output
5959  // also ignore clefs at the end of a measure
5960  // these will be output at the start of the next measure
5961  const auto cle = toClef(el);
5962  const auto ti = cle->segment()->tick();
5963  clefDebug("exportxml: clef in measure ti=%d ct=%d gen=%d", ti, int(cle->clefType()), el->generated());
5964  if (el->generated()) {
5965  clefDebug("exportxml: generated clef not exported");
5966  }
5967  else if (!el->generated() && tickIsInMiddleOfMeasure(ti, m))
5968  clef(sstaff, cle->clefType(), color2xml(cle));
5969  else if (!el->generated() && (ti == m->tick()) && (cle->segment()->segmentType() != SegmentType::HeaderClef))
5970  clef(sstaff, cle->clefType(), color2xml(cle) + QString(" after-barline=\"yes\""));
5971  else
5972  clefDebug("exportxml: clef not exported");
5973  }
5974  else if (el->isChord()) {
5975  const auto c = toChord(el);
5976  // ise grace after
5977  if (c) {
5978  const auto ll = &c->lyrics();
5979  for (const auto g : c->graceNotesBefore()) {
5980  chord(g, sstaff, ll, useDrumset);
5981  }
5982  chord(c, sstaff, ll, useDrumset);
5983  for (const auto g : c->graceNotesAfter()) {
5984  chord(g, sstaff, ll, useDrumset);
5985  }
5986  }
5987  }
5988  else if (el->isRest()) {
5989  const auto r = toRest(el);
5990  if (!(r->isGap()))
5991  rest(r, sstaff);
5992  }
5993  else if (el->isBarLine()) {
5994  const auto barln = toBarLine(el);
5995  if (tickIsInMiddleOfMeasure(barln->tick(), m))
5996  barlineMiddle(barln);
5997  }
5998  else if (el->isKeySig() || el->isTimeSig() || el->isBreath()) {
5999  // handled elsewhere
6000  }
6001  else
6002  qDebug("ExportMusicXml::write unknown segment type %s", el->name());
6003  }
6004 
6005 //---------------------------------------------------------
6006 // writeStaffDetails
6007 //---------------------------------------------------------
6008 
6009 /**
6010  Write the staff details for \a part to \a xml.
6011  */
6012 
6013 static void writeStaffDetails(XmlWriter& xml, const Part* part)
6014  {
6015  const Instrument* instrument = part->instrument();
6016  int staves = part->nstaves();
6017 
6018  // staff details
6019  // TODO: decide how to handle linked regular / TAB staff
6020  // currently exported as a two staff part ...
6021  for (int i = 0; i < staves; i++) {
6022  Staff* st = part->staff(i);
6023  if (st->lines(Fraction(0,1)) != 5 || st->isTabStaff(Fraction(0,1))) {
6024  if (staves > 1)
6025  xml.stag(QString("staff-details number=\"%1\"").arg(i+1));
6026  else
6027  xml.stag("staff-details");
6028  xml.tag("staff-lines", st->lines(Fraction(0,1)));
6029  if (st->isTabStaff(Fraction(0,1)) && instrument->stringData()) {
6030  QList<instrString> l = instrument->stringData()->stringList();
6031  for (int ii = 0; ii < l.size(); ii++) {
6032  char step = ' ';
6033  int alter = 0;
6034  int octave = 0;
6035  midipitch2xml(l.at(ii).pitch, step, alter, octave);
6036  xml.stag(QString("staff-tuning line=\"%1\"").arg(ii+1));
6037  xml.tag("tuning-step", QString("%1").arg(step));
6038  if (alter)
6039  xml.tag("tuning-alter", alter);
6040  xml.tag("tuning-octave", octave);
6041  xml.etag();
6042  }
6043  }
6044  xml.etag();
6045  }
6046  }
6047  }
6048 
6049 //---------------------------------------------------------
6050 // writeInstrumentDetails
6051 //---------------------------------------------------------
6052 
6053 /**
6054  Write the instrument details for \a instrument.
6055  */
6056 
6057 void ExportMusicXml::writeInstrumentDetails(const Instrument* instrument)
6058  {
6059  if (instrument->transpose().chromatic) {
6060  _attr.doAttr(_xml, true);
6061  _xml.stag("transpose");
6062  _xml.tag("diatonic", instrument->transpose().diatonic % 7);
6063  _xml.tag("chromatic", instrument->transpose().chromatic % 12);
6064  int octaveChange = instrument->transpose().chromatic / 12;
6065  if (octaveChange != 0)
6066  _xml.tag("octave-change", octaveChange);
6067  _xml.etag();
6068  _attr.doAttr(_xml, false);
6069  }
6070  }
6071 
6072 //---------------------------------------------------------
6073 // annotationsWithoutNote
6074 //---------------------------------------------------------
6075 
6076 /**
6077  Write the annotations that could not be attached to notes.
6078  */
6079 
6080 static void annotationsWithoutNote(ExportMusicXml* exp, const int strack, const int staves, const Measure* const measure)
6081  {
6082  for (auto segment = measure->first(); segment; segment = segment->next()) {
6083  if (segment->segmentType() == SegmentType::ChordRest) {
6084  for (const auto element : segment->annotations()) {
6085  if (!element->isFiguredBass() && !element->isHarmony()) { // handled elsewhere
6086  const auto wtrack = findTrackForAnnotations(element->track(), segment); // track to write annotation
6087  if (strack <= element->track() && element->track() < (strack + VOICES * staves) && wtrack < 0)
6088  commonAnnotations(exp, element, staves > 1 ? 1 : 0);
6089  }
6090  }
6091  }
6092 
6093  }
6094  }
6095 
6096 //---------------------------------------------------------
6097 // MeasureNumberStateHandler
6098 //---------------------------------------------------------
6099 
6100 MeasureNumberStateHandler::MeasureNumberStateHandler()
6101  {
6102  init();
6103  }
6104 
6105 void MeasureNumberStateHandler::init()
6106  {
6107  _measureNo = 1;
6108  _irregularMeasureNo = 1;
6109  _pickupMeasureNo = 1;
6110  }
6111 
6112 
6113 void MeasureNumberStateHandler::updateForMeasure(const Measure* const m)
6114  {
6115  // restart measure numbering after a section break if startWithMeasureOne is set
6116  // check the previous MeasureBase instead of Measure to catch breaks in frames too
6117  const MeasureBase* previousMB = m->prev();
6118  if (previousMB)
6119  previousMB = previousMB->findPotentialSectionBreak();
6120 
6121  if (previousMB) {
6122  const auto layoutSectionBreak = previousMB->sectionBreakElement();
6123  if (layoutSectionBreak && layoutSectionBreak->startWithMeasureOne())
6124  init();
6125  }
6126 
6127  // update measure numbers and cache result
6128  _cachedAttributes = " number=";
6129  if ((_irregularMeasureNo + _measureNo) == 2 && m->irregular()) {
6130  _cachedAttributes += "\"0\" implicit=\"yes\"";
6131  _pickupMeasureNo++;
6132  }
6133  else if (m->irregular())
6134  _cachedAttributes += QString("\"X%1\" implicit=\"yes\"").arg(_irregularMeasureNo++);
6135  else
6136  _cachedAttributes += QString("\"%1\"").arg(_measureNo++);
6137  }
6138 
6139 QString MeasureNumberStateHandler::measureNumber() const
6140  {
6141  return _cachedAttributes;
6142  }
6143 
6144 bool MeasureNumberStateHandler::isFirstActualMeasure() const
6145  {
6146  return (_irregularMeasureNo + _measureNo + _pickupMeasureNo) == 4;
6147  }
6148 
6149 //---------------------------------------------------------
6150 // findLastSystemWithMeasures
6151 //---------------------------------------------------------
6152 
6153 static System* findLastSystemWithMeasures(const Page* const page)
6154  {
6155  for (int i = page->systems().size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
6156  const auto s = page->systems().at(i);
6157  const auto m = s->firstMeasure();
6158  if (m)
6159  return s;
6160  }
6161  return nullptr;
6162  }
6163 
6164 //---------------------------------------------------------
6165 // isFirstMeasureInSystem
6166 //---------------------------------------------------------
6167 
6168 static bool isFirstMeasureInSystem(const Measure* const measure)
6169  {
6170  const auto system = measure->mmRest1()->system();
6171  const auto firstMeasureInSystem = system->firstMeasure();
6172  const auto realFirstMeasureInSystem = firstMeasureInSystem->isMMRest() ? firstMeasureInSystem->mmRestFirst() : firstMeasureInSystem;
6173  return measure == realFirstMeasureInSystem;
6174  }
6175 //---------------------------------------------------------
6176 // isFirstMeasureInLastSystem
6177 //---------------------------------------------------------
6178 
6179 static bool isFirstMeasureInLastSystem(const Measure* const measure)
6180  {
6181  const auto system = measure->mmRest1()->system();
6182  const auto page = system->page();
6183 
6184  /*
6185  Notes on multi-measure rest handling:
6186  Function mmRest1() returns either the measure itself (if not part of multi-measure rest)
6187  or the replacing multi-measure rest measure.
6188  Using this is required as a measure that is covered by a multi-measure rest has no system.
6189  Furthermore, the first measure in a system starting with a multi-measure rest is the a multi-
6190  measure rest itself instead of the first covered measure.
6191  */
6192 
6193  const auto lastSystem = findLastSystemWithMeasures(page);
6194  if (!lastSystem)
6195  return false; // degenerate case: no system with measures found
6196  const auto firstMeasureInLastSystem = lastSystem->firstMeasure();
6197  const auto realFirstMeasureInLastSystem = firstMeasureInLastSystem->isMMRest() ? firstMeasureInLastSystem->mmRestFirst() : firstMeasureInLastSystem;
6198  return measure == realFirstMeasureInLastSystem;
6199  }
6200 
6201 //---------------------------------------------------------
6202 // systemHasMeasures
6203 //---------------------------------------------------------
6204 
6205 static bool systemHasMeasures(const System* const system)
6206  {
6207  return system->firstMeasure();
6208  }
6209 
6210 //---------------------------------------------------------
6211 // findTextFramesToWriteAsWordsAbove
6212 //---------------------------------------------------------
6213 
6214 static std::vector<TBox*> findTextFramesToWriteAsWordsAbove(const Measure* const measure)
6215  {
6216  const auto system = measure->mmRest1()->system();
6217  const auto page = system->page();
6218  const auto systemIndex = page->systems().indexOf(system);
6219  std::vector<TBox*> tboxes;
6220  if (isFirstMeasureInSystem(measure)) {
6221  for (auto idx = systemIndex - 1; idx >= 0 && !systemHasMeasures(page->system(idx)); --idx) {
6222  const auto sys = page->system(idx);
6223  for (const auto mb : sys->measures()) {
6224  if (mb->isTBox()) {
6225  auto tbox = toTBox(mb);
6226  tboxes.insert(tboxes.begin(), tbox);
6227  }
6228  }
6229  }
6230  }
6231  return tboxes;
6232  }
6233 
6234 //---------------------------------------------------------
6235 // findTextFramesToWriteAsWordsBelow
6236 //---------------------------------------------------------
6237 
6238 static std::vector<TBox*> findTextFramesToWriteAsWordsBelow(const Measure* const measure)
6239  {
6240  const auto system = measure->mmRest1()->system();
6241  const auto page = system->page();
6242  const auto systemIndex = page->systems().indexOf(system);
6243  std::vector<TBox*> tboxes;
6244  if (isFirstMeasureInLastSystem(measure)) {
6245  for (auto idx = systemIndex + 1; idx < page->systems().size() /* && !systemHasMeasures(page->system(idx))*/; ++idx) {
6246  const auto sys = page->system(idx);
6247  for (const auto mb : sys->measures()) {
6248  if (mb->isTBox()) {
6249  auto tbox = toTBox(mb);
6250  tboxes.insert(tboxes.begin(), tbox);
6251  }
6252  }
6253  }
6254  }
6255  return tboxes;
6256  }
6257 
6258 //---------------------------------------------------------
6259 // writeMeasureTracks
6260 //---------------------------------------------------------
6261 
6262 /**
6263  Write data contained in the measure's tracks.
6264  */
6265 
6266 void ExportMusicXml::writeMeasureTracks(const Measure* const m,
6267  const int partIndex,
6268  const int strack, const int staves, // TODO remove ??
6269  const bool useDrumset,
6270  FigBassMap& fbMap,
6271  QSet<const Spanner*>& spannersStopped)
6272  {
6273  bool tboxesAboveWritten = false;
6274  const auto tboxesAbove = findTextFramesToWriteAsWordsAbove(m);
6275 
6276  bool tboxesBelowWritten = false;
6277  const auto tboxesBelow = findTextFramesToWriteAsWordsBelow(m);
6278 
6279  const int etrack = strack + VOICES * staves;
6280 
6281  for (int st = strack; st < etrack; ++st) {
6282  // sstaff - xml staff number, counting from 1 for this
6283  // instrument
6284  // special number 0 -> don’t show staff number in
6285  // xml output (because there is only one staff)
6286 
6287  int sstaff = (staves > 1) ? st - strack + VOICES : 0;
6288  sstaff /= VOICES;
6289  for (auto seg = m->first(); seg; seg = seg->next()) {
6290  const auto el = seg->element(st);
6291  if (!el) {
6292  continue;
6293  }
6294  // must ignore start repeat to prevent spurious backup/forward
6295  if (el->isBarLine() && toBarLine(el)->barLineType() == BarLineType::START_REPEAT)
6296  continue;
6297 
6298  // generate backup or forward to the start time of the element
6299  if (_tick != seg->tick()) {
6300  _attr.doAttr(_xml, false);
6301  moveToTick(seg->tick());
6302  }
6303 
6304  // handle annotations and spanners (directions attached to this note or rest)
6305  if (el->isChordRest()) {
6306  _attr.doAttr(_xml, false);
6307  const bool isFirstPart = (partIndex == 0);
6308  const bool isLastPart = (partIndex == (_score->parts().size() - 1));
6309  if (!tboxesAboveWritten && isFirstPart) {
6310  for (const auto tbox : tboxesAbove) {
6311  // note: use mmRest1() to get at a possible multi-measure rest,
6312  // as the covered measure would be positioned at 0,0.
6313  tboxTextAsWords(tbox->text(), 0, tbox->text()->canvasPos() - m->mmRest1()->canvasPos());
6314  }
6315  tboxesAboveWritten = true;
6316  }
6317  if (!tboxesBelowWritten && isLastPart && (etrack - VOICES) <= st) {
6318  for (const auto tbox : tboxesBelow) {
6319  const auto lastStaffNr = st / VOICES;
6320  const auto sys = m->mmRest1()->system();
6321  auto textPos = tbox->text()->canvasPos() - m->mmRest1()->canvasPos();
6322  if (lastStaffNr < sys->staves()->size()) {
6323  // convert to position relative to last staff of system
6324  textPos.setY(textPos.y() - (sys->staffCanvasYpage(lastStaffNr) - sys->staffCanvasYpage(0)));
6325  }
6326  tboxTextAsWords(tbox->text(), sstaff, textPos);
6327  }
6328  tboxesBelowWritten = true;
6329  }
6330  harmonies(this, st, seg, div);
6331  annotations(this, strack, etrack, st, sstaff, seg);
6332  figuredBass(_xml, strack, etrack, st, static_cast<const ChordRest*>(el), fbMap, div);
6333  spannerStart(this, strack, etrack, st, sstaff, seg);
6334  }
6335 
6336  // write element el if necessary
6337  writeElement(el, m, sstaff, useDrumset);
6338 
6339  // handle annotations and spanners (directions attached to this note or rest)
6340  if (el->isChordRest()) {
6341  const int spannerStaff = st / VOICES;
6342  const int starttrack = spannerStaff * VOICES;
6343  const int endtrack = (spannerStaff + 1) * VOICES;
6344  spannerStop(this, starttrack, endtrack, _tick, sstaff, spannersStopped);
6345  }
6346 
6347  } // for (Segment* seg = ...
6348  _attr.stop(_xml);
6349  } // for (int st = ...
6350  }
6351 
6352 //---------------------------------------------------------
6353 // writeMeasure
6354 //---------------------------------------------------------
6355 
6356 /**
6357  Write a measure.
6358  */
6359 
6360 void ExportMusicXml::writeMeasure(const Measure* const m,
6361  const int partIndex,
6362  const int staffCount,
6363  MeasureNumberStateHandler& mnsh,
6364  FigBassMap& fbMap,
6365  const MeasurePrintContext& mpc,
6366  QSet<const Spanner*>& spannersStopped)
6367  {
6368  const auto part = _score->parts().at(partIndex);
6369  const int staves = part->nstaves();
6370  const int strack = part->startTrack();
6371  const int etrack = part->endTrack();
6372 
6373  // pickup and other irregular measures need special care
6374  QString measureTag = "measure";
6375  mnsh.updateForMeasure(m);
6376  measureTag += mnsh.measureNumber();
6377  const bool isFirstActualMeasure = mnsh.isFirstActualMeasure();
6378 
6379  if (preferences.getBool(PREF_EXPORT_MUSICXML_EXPORTLAYOUT))
6380  measureTag += QString(" width=\"%1\"").arg(QString::number(m->bbox().width() / DPMM / millimeters * tenths,'f',2));
6381 
6382  _xml.stag(measureTag);
6383 
6384  print(m, partIndex, staffCount, staves, mpc);
6385 
6386  _attr.start();
6387 
6388  findTrills(m, strack, etrack, _trillStart, _trillStop);
6389 
6390  // barline left must be the first element in a measure
6391  barlineLeft(m);
6392 
6393  // output attributes with the first actual measure (pickup or regular)
6394  if (isFirstActualMeasure) {
6395  _attr.doAttr(_xml, true);
6396  _xml.tag("divisions", MScore::division / div);
6397  }
6398 
6399  // output attributes at start of measure: key, time
6400  keysigTimesig(m, part);
6401 
6402  // output attributes with the first actual measure (pickup or regular) only
6403  if (isFirstActualMeasure) {
6404  if (staves > 1)
6405  _xml.tag("staves", staves);
6406  if (instrMap.size() > 1)
6407  _xml.tag("instruments", instrMap.size());
6408  }
6409 
6410  // make sure clefs at end of measure get exported at start of next measure
6411  findAndExportClef(m, staves, strack, etrack);
6412 
6413  // make sure a clef gets exported if none is found
6414  exportDefaultClef(part, m);
6415 
6416  // output attributes with the first actual measure (pickup or regular) only
6417  if (isFirstActualMeasure) {
6418  writeStaffDetails(_xml, part);
6419  writeInstrumentDetails(part->instrument());
6420  }
6421 
6422  // output attribute at start of measure: measure-style
6423  measureStyle(_xml, _attr, m);
6424 
6425  // MuseScore limitation: repeats are always in the first part
6426  // and are implicitly placed at either measure start or stop
6427  if (partIndex == 0)
6428  repeatAtMeasureStart(_xml, _attr, m, strack, etrack, strack);
6429 
6430  // write data in the tracks
6431  writeMeasureTracks(m, partIndex, strack, staves, part->instrument()->useDrumset(), fbMap, spannersStopped);
6432 
6433  // write the annotations that could not be attached to notes
6434  annotationsWithoutNote(this, strack, staves, m);
6435 
6436  // move to end of measure (in case of incomplete last voice)
6437  #ifdef DEBUG_TICK
6438  qDebug("end of measure");
6439  #endif
6440  moveToTick(m->endTick());
6441  if (partIndex == 0)
6442  repeatAtMeasureStop(_xml, m, strack, etrack, strack);
6443  // note: don't use "m->repeatFlags() & Repeat::END" here, because more
6444  // barline types need to be handled besides repeat end ("light-heavy")
6445  barlineRight(m, strack, etrack);
6446  _xml.etag();
6447  }
6448 
6449 //---------------------------------------------------------
6450 // measureWritten
6451 //---------------------------------------------------------
6452 
6453 void MeasurePrintContext::measureWritten(const Measure* m)
6454  {
6455  scoreStart = false;
6456  pageStart = false;
6457  systemStart = false;
6458  prevMeasure = m;
6459  }
6460 
6461 //---------------------------------------------------------
6462 // writeParts
6463 //---------------------------------------------------------
6464 
6465 /**
6466  Write all parts.
6467  */
6468 
6469 void ExportMusicXml::writeParts()
6470  {
6471  int staffCount = 0;
6472  const auto& parts = _score->parts();
6473 
6474  for (int partIndex = 0; partIndex < parts.size(); ++partIndex) {
6475  const auto part = parts.at(partIndex);
6476  _tick = { 0,1 };
6477  _xml.stag(QString("part id=\"P%1\"").arg(partIndex+1));
6478 
6479  _trillStart.clear();
6480  _trillStop.clear();
6481  initInstrMap(instrMap, part->instruments(), _score);
6482 
6483  MeasureNumberStateHandler mnsh;
6484  FigBassMap fbMap; // pending figured bass extends
6485 
6486  // set of spanners already stopped in this part
6487  // required to prevent multiple spanner stops for the same spanner
6488  QSet<const Spanner*> spannersStopped;
6489 
6490  const auto& pages = _score->pages();
6491  MeasurePrintContext mpc;
6492 
6493  for (int pageIndex = 0; pageIndex < pages.size(); ++pageIndex) {
6494  const auto page = pages.at(pageIndex);
6495  mpc.pageStart = true;
6496  const auto& systems = page->systems();
6497 
6498  for (int systemIndex = 0; systemIndex < systems.size(); ++systemIndex) {
6499  const auto system = systems.at(systemIndex);
6500  mpc.systemStart = true;
6501 
6502  for (const auto mb : system->measures()) {
6503  if (!mb->isMeasure())
6504  continue;
6505  const auto m = toMeasure(mb);
6506 
6507  // write the measure or, in case of a multi measure rest,
6508  // the measure range it replaces
6509  if (m->isMMRest()) {
6510  auto m1 = m->mmRestFirst();
6511  const auto m2 = m->mmRestLast();
6512  for (;; ) {
6513  if (m1->isMeasure()) {
6514  writeMeasure(m1, partIndex, staffCount, mnsh, fbMap, mpc, spannersStopped);
6515  mpc.measureWritten(m1);
6516  }
6517  if (m1 == m2)
6518  break;
6519  m1 = m1->nextMeasure();
6520  }
6521  }
6522  else {
6523  writeMeasure(m, partIndex, staffCount, mnsh, fbMap, mpc, spannersStopped);
6524  mpc.measureWritten(m);
6525  }
6526 
6527  }
6528  mpc.prevSystem = system;
6529  }
6530  mpc.lastSystemPrevPage = mpc.prevSystem;
6531  }
6532 
6533  staffCount += part->nstaves();
6534  _xml.etag();
6535  }
6536  }
6537 
6538 //---------------------------------------------------------
6539 // write
6540 //---------------------------------------------------------
6541 
6542 /**
6543  Write the score to \a dev in MusicXML format.
6544  */
6545 
6546 void ExportMusicXml::write(QIODevice* dev)
6547  {
6548  // must export in transposed pitch to prevent
6549  // losing the transposition information
6550  // if necessary, switch concert pitch mode off
6551  // before export and restore it after export
6552  bool concertPitch = score()->styleB(Sid::concertPitch);
6553  if (concertPitch) {
6554  score()->startCmd();
6555  score()->undo(new ChangeStyleVal(score(), Sid::concertPitch, false));
6556  score()->doLayout(); // this is only allowed in a cmd context to not corrupt the undo/redo stack
6557  }
6558 
6559  calcDivisions();
6560 
6561  for (int i = 0; i < MAX_NUMBER_LEVEL; ++i) {
6562  brackets[i] = nullptr;
6563  dashes[i] = nullptr;
6564  hairpins[i] = nullptr;
6565  ottavas[i] = nullptr;
6566  trills[i] = nullptr;
6567  }
6568 
6569  _xml.setDevice(dev);
6570  _xml.setCodec("UTF-8");
6571  _xml << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n";
6572  _xml << "<!DOCTYPE score-partwise PUBLIC \"-//Recordare//DTD MusicXML 3.1 Partwise//EN\" \"http://www.musicxml.org/dtds/partwise.dtd\">\n";
6573 
6574  _xml.stag("score-partwise version=\"3.1\"");
6575 
6576  work(_score->measures()->first());
6577  identification(_xml, _score);
6578 
6579  if (preferences.getBool(PREF_EXPORT_MUSICXML_EXPORTLAYOUT)) {
6580  defaults(_xml, _score, millimeters, tenths);
6581  credits(_xml);
6582  }
6583 
6584  partList(_xml, _score, instrMap);
6585  writeParts();
6586 
6587  _xml.etag();
6588 
6589  if (concertPitch) {
6590  // restore concert pitch
6591  score()->endCmd(true); // rollback
6592  }
6593  }
6594 
6595 //---------------------------------------------------------
6596 // saveXml
6597 // return false on error
6598 //---------------------------------------------------------
6599 
6600 /**
6601  Save Score as MusicXML file \a name.
6602 
6603  Return false on error.
6604  */
6605 
6606 bool saveXml(Score* score, QIODevice* device)
6607  {
6608  ExportMusicXml em(score);
6609  em.write(device);
6610  return true;
6611  }
6612 
6613 bool saveXml(Score* score, const QString& name)
6614  {
6615  QFile f(name);
6616  if (!f.open(QIODevice::WriteOnly))
6617  return false;
6618 
6619  bool res = saveXml(score, &f) && (f.error() == QFile::NoError);
6620  f.close();
6621  return res;
6622  }
6623 
6624 //---------------------------------------------------------
6625 // saveMxl
6626 // return false on error
6627 //---------------------------------------------------------
6628 
6629 /**
6630  Save Score as compressed MusicXML file \a name.
6631 
6632  Return false on error.
6633  */
6634 
6635 // META-INF/container.xml:
6636 // <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
6637 // <container>
6638 // <rootfiles>
6639 // <rootfile full-path="testHello.xml"/>
6640 // </rootfiles>
6641 // </container>
6642 
6643 static void writeMxlArchive(Score* score, MQZipWriter& zipwriter, const QString& filename)
6644  {
6645  QBuffer cbuf;
6646  cbuf.open(QIODevice::ReadWrite);
6647 
6648  XmlWriter xml(score);
6649  xml.setDevice(&cbuf);
6650  xml.setCodec("UTF-8");
6651  xml << "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?>\n";
6652  xml.stag("container");
6653  xml.stag("rootfiles");
6654  xml.stag(QString("rootfile full-path=\"%1\"").arg(filename));
6655  xml.etag();
6656  xml.etag();
6657  xml.etag();
6658  cbuf.seek(0);
6659 
6660  //uz.addDirectory("META-INF");
6661  zipwriter.addFile("META-INF/container.xml", cbuf.data());
6662 
6663  QBuffer dbuf;
6664  dbuf.open(QIODevice::ReadWrite);
6665  ExportMusicXml em(score);
6666  em.write(&dbuf);
6667  dbuf.seek(0);
6668  zipwriter.addFile(filename, dbuf.data());
6669  }
6670 
6671 bool saveMxl(Score* score, QIODevice* device)
6672  {
6673  MQZipWriter uz(device);
6674 
6675  //anonymized filename since we don't know the actual one here
6676  QString fn = "score.xml";
6677  writeMxlArchive(score, uz, fn);
6678  uz.close();
6679 
6680  return true;
6681  }
6682 
6683 bool saveMxl(Score* score, const QString& name)
6684  {
6685  MQZipWriter uz(name);
6686 
6687  QFileInfo fi(name);
6688  QString fn = fi.completeBaseName() + ".xml";
6689  writeMxlArchive(score, uz, fn);
6690 
6691  return true;
6692  }
6693 
6694 double ExportMusicXml::getTenthsFromInches(double inches) const
6695  {
6696  return inches * INCH / millimeters * tenths;
6697  }
6698 
6699 double ExportMusicXml::getTenthsFromDots(double dots) const
6700  {
6701  return dots / DPMM / millimeters * tenths;
6702  }
6703 
6704 //---------------------------------------------------------
6705 // harmony
6706 //---------------------------------------------------------
6707 
6708 void ExportMusicXml::harmony(Harmony const* const h, FretDiagram const* const fd, int offset)
6709  {
6710  // this code was probably in place to allow chord symbols shifted *right* to export with offset
6711  // since this was at once time the only way to get a chord to appear over beat 3 in an empty 4/4 measure
6712  // but the value was calculated incorrectly (should be divided by spatium) and would be better off using offset anyhow
6713  // since we now support placement of chord symbols over "empty" beats directly,
6714  // and we don't generally export position info for other elements
6715  // it's just as well to not bother doing so here
6716  //double rx = h->offset().x()*10;
6717  //QString relative;
6718  //if (rx > 0) {
6719  // relative = QString(" relative-x=\"%1\"").arg(QString::number(rx,'f',2));
6720  // }
6721  int rootTpc = h->rootTpc();
6722  if (rootTpc != Tpc::TPC_INVALID) {
6723  QString tagName = "harmony";
6724  bool frame = h->hasFrame();
6725  tagName += QString(" print-frame=\"%1\"").arg(frame ? "yes" : "no"); // .append(relative));
6726  tagName += color2xml(h);
6727  _xml.stag(tagName);
6728  _xml.stag("root");
6729  _xml.tag("root-step", tpc2stepName(rootTpc));
6730  int alter = int(tpc2alter(rootTpc));
6731  if (alter)
6732  _xml.tag("root-alter", alter);
6733  _xml.etag();
6734 
6735  if (!h->xmlKind().isEmpty()) {
6736  QString s = "kind";
6737  QString kindText = h->musicXmlText();
6738  if (h->musicXmlText() != "")
6739  s += " text=\"" + kindText + "\"";
6740  if (h->xmlSymbols() == "yes")
6741  s += " use-symbols=\"yes\"";
6742  if (h->xmlParens() == "yes")
6743  s += " parentheses-degrees=\"yes\"";
6744  _xml.tag(s, h->xmlKind());
6745  QStringList l = h->xmlDegrees();
6746  if (!l.isEmpty()) {
6747  for (QString tag : qAsConst(l)) {
6748  QString degreeText;
6749  if (h->xmlKind().startsWith("suspended")
6750  && tag.startsWith("add") && tag[3].isDigit()
6751  && !kindText.isEmpty() && kindText[0].isDigit()) {
6752  // hack to correct text for suspended chords whose kind text has degree information baked in
6753  // (required by some other applications)
6754  int tagDegree = tag.midRef(3).toInt();
6755  QString kindTextExtension;
6756  for (int i = 0; i < kindText.length() && kindText[i].isDigit(); ++i)
6757  kindTextExtension[i] = kindText[i];
6758  int kindExtension = kindTextExtension.toInt();
6759  if (tagDegree <= kindExtension && (tagDegree & 1) && (kindExtension & 1))
6760  degreeText = " text=\"\"";
6761  }
6762  _xml.stag("degree");
6763  alter = 0;
6764  int idx = 3;
6765  if (tag[idx] == '#') {
6766  alter = 1;
6767  ++idx;
6768  }
6769  else if (tag[idx] == 'b') {
6770  alter = -1;
6771  ++idx;
6772  }
6773  _xml.tag(QString("degree-value%1").arg(degreeText), tag.mid(idx));
6774  _xml.tag("degree-alter", alter); // finale insists on this even if 0
6775  if (tag.startsWith("add"))
6776  _xml.tag(QString("degree-type%1").arg(degreeText), "add");
6777  else if (tag.startsWith("sub"))
6778  _xml.tag("degree-type", "subtract");
6779  else if (tag.startsWith("alt"))
6780  _xml.tag("degree-type", "alter");
6781  _xml.etag();
6782  }
6783  }
6784  }
6785  else {
6786  if (h->extensionName() == 0)
6787  _xml.tag("kind", "");
6788  else
6789  _xml.tag(QString("kind text=\"%1\"").arg(h->extensionName()), "");
6790  }
6791 
6792  int baseTpc = h->baseTpc();
6793  if (baseTpc != Tpc::TPC_INVALID) {
6794  _xml.stag("bass");
6795  _xml.tag("bass-step", tpc2stepName(baseTpc));
6796  alter = int(tpc2alter(baseTpc));
6797  if (alter) {
6798  _xml.tag("bass-alter", alter);
6799  }
6800  _xml.etag();
6801  }
6802  if (offset > 0)
6803  _xml.tag("offset", offset);
6804  if (fd)
6805  fd->writeMusicXML(_xml);
6806 
6807  _xml.etag();
6808  }
6809  else {
6810  //
6811  // export an unrecognized Chord
6812  // which may contain arbitrary text
6813  //
6814  if (h->hasFrame())
6815  _xml.stag(QString("harmony print-frame=\"yes\"")); // .append(relative));
6816  else
6817  _xml.stag(QString("harmony print-frame=\"no\"")); // .append(relative));
6818  const auto textNameEscaped = h->hTextName().toHtmlEscaped();
6819  switch (h->harmonyType()) {
6820  case HarmonyType::NASHVILLE: {
6821  _xml.tag("function", h->hFunction());
6822  QString k = "kind text=\"" + textNameEscaped + "\"";
6823  _xml.tag(k, "none");
6824  }
6825  break;
6826  case HarmonyType::ROMAN: {
6827  // TODO: parse?
6828  _xml.tag("function", h->hTextName()); // note: HTML escape done by tag()
6829  QString k = "kind text=\"\"";
6830  _xml.tag(k, "none");
6831  }
6832  break;
6833  case HarmonyType::STANDARD:
6834  default: {
6835  _xml.stag("root");
6836  _xml.tag("root-step text=\"\"", "C");
6837  _xml.etag(); // root
6838  QString k = "kind text=\"" + textNameEscaped + "\"";
6839  _xml.tag(k, "none");
6840  }
6841  break;
6842  }
6843  _xml.etag(); // harmony
6844 #if 0
6845  // prior to 2.0, MuseScore exported unrecognized chords as plain text
6846  xml.stag("direction");
6847  xml.stag("direction-type");
6848  xml.tag("words", h->text());
6849  xml.etag();
6850  xml.etag();
6851 #endif
6852  }
6853 #if 0
6854  // this is very old code that may never have actually been used
6855  xml.tag(QString("kind text=\"%1\"").arg(h->extensionName()), extension);
6856  for (int i = 0; i < h->numberOfDegrees(); i++) {
6857  HDegree hd = h->degree(i);
6858  HDegreeType tp = hd.type();
6859  if (tp == HDegreeType::ADD || tp == HDegreeType::ALTER || tp == HDegreeType::SUBTRACT) {
6860  xml.stag("degree");
6861  xml.tag("degree-value", hd.value());
6862  xml.tag("degree-alter", hd.alter());
6863  switch (tp) {
6864  case HDegreeType::ADD:
6865  xml.tag("degree-type", "add");
6866  break;
6867  case HDegreeType::ALTER:
6868  xml.tag("degree-type", "alter");
6869  break;
6870  case HDegreeType::SUBTRACT:
6871  xml.tag("degree-type", "subtract");
6872  break;
6873  default:
6874  break;
6875  }
6876  xml.etag();
6877  }
6878  }
6879 #endif
6880  }
6881 
6882 }
Ms::MasterScore::midiMapping
std::vector< MidiMapping > & midiMapping()
Definition: score.h:1396
Ms::ExportMusicXml::_xml
XmlWriter _xml
Definition: exportxml.cpp:317
Ms::Notations
Definition: exportxml.cpp:188
Ms::ElementType::HARMONY
Ms::startTupletAtLevel
static const Tuplet * startTupletAtLevel(const DurationElement *const cr, const int level)
Definition: exportxml.cpp:2151
Ms::BarLineType::BROKEN
Ms::isFirstMeasureInLastSystem
static bool isFirstMeasureInLastSystem(const Measure *const measure)
Definition: exportxml.cpp:6179
